quiz.title: Are you safe?
quiz.description: Basic protective measures against the new coronavirus
quiz.successMessage: You are now aware of Basic protective measures against the new coronavirus

questions.title: Do you Wash your hands frequently?

answers.title: Yes, I wash my hands frequently;
description: Good. Washing your hands with soap and water or using alcohol-based hand rub kills viruses that may be on your hands.

answers.title: Nope
description: Wash your hands frequently, Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water. Why? Washing your hands with soap and water or using alcohol-based hand rub kills viruses that may be on your hands.

questions.title: Do you often touch your eyes, nose and mouth?
questions.hint: Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth

answers.title: Yes, I do
description: Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth
Why?
Hands touch many surfaces and can pick up viruses. Once contaminated, hands can transfer the virus to your eyes, nose or mouth. From there, the virus can enter your body and can make you sick.

answers.title: No, I don't
description: Good, Hands touch many surfaces and can pick up viruses. Once contaminated, hands can transfer the virus to your eyes, nose or mouth. From there, the virus can enter your body and can make you sick.

questions.title: Do you cover your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze.?

answers.title: Yes, I do
description: Make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately.

answers.title: No I don't
description: Practice respiratory hygiene.

Make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately.
Why?
Droplets spread virus. By following good respiratory hygiene you protect the people around you from viruses such as cold, flu and COVID-19.

questions.title: Are you a patient of any Cardiovascular or Chronic respiratory diseases, Diabetes, Hypertension or Cancer?

answers.title: Yes, I Am
description: The risk of fatality from Coronavirus is higher if you have any such pre-existing conditions. Take extra care if you fall into the category. Seek medical attention immediately if you experience the symptoms.

answers.title: No, I'm not
description: Having no such such pre-existing conditions will increase the odds of survival, if infected

questions.title: What age group do you belong to?

answers.title: Below 40
description: The fatality from Coronavirus is around 0.2% for patients below 40. Precautions and prompt medical care can help mitigate risk which increase your odds of survival
The fatality from Coronavirus is around 0.4% for patients in their 40s. Precautions and prompt medical care can help mitigate risk which increase your odds of survival.
The fatality from Coronavirus is around 1.3% for patients in their 50s. Precautions and prompt medical care can help mitigate risk which increase your odds of survival.

The fatality from Coronavirus is around 3.6% for patients in their 60s. Current or Pre-existing medical conditions further increases risk. Precautions and prompt medical care can help mitigate risk which increase your odds of survival.

The fatality of Coronavirus is around 8.0% for patients in their 70s. Current or Pre-existing medical conditions further increases risk. Maximum Care should be taken to prevent infection. Precautions and prompt medical care can help mitigate risk which increase your odds of survival.
The fatality of Coronavirus is highest at 14.8% for patients older than 80. Current or Pre-existing medical conditions further increases risk. Maximum Care should be taken to prevent infection.

questions.title: If you find yourself with fever, cough or difficulty in breathing, do you know exactly what to do in the current scenario?

answers.title: Yes, I do
description: If you have fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical care early Stay home if you feel unwell. If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and call in advance. Follow the directions of your local health authority.
Why?

National and local authorities will have the most up to date information on the situation in your area. Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility. This will also protect you and help prevent spread of viruses and other infections.

answers.title: No I don't
description: If you have fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical care early Stay home if you feel unwell. If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and call in advance. Follow the directions of your local health authority.
Why?

National and local authorities will have the most up to date information on the situation in your area. Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility. This will also protect you and help prevent spread of viruses and other infections.
